content.title: Intro
content.content:
1922
Preceded by
1922
1923
Year
1924
Followed by
1924

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1923.

content.title: January
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem "Iúmonna Gold Galdre Bewunden" is published in The Gryphon.

content.title: February
content.content:
1 - Frank Duncan, who would play Torhthelm in The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth, Beorhthelm's Son (radio play) and Legolas and Halbarad in The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series), is born.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 6.

content.title: March
content.content: 21 - Peter Pratt, who would play Balin in The Hobbit (1968 radio series), is born.

content.title: April
content.content:
4 - Actor Peter Vaughan is born.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien's review "Holy Maidenhood" is published in The Times Literary Supplement.

content.title: June
content.content: ? - The collection A Northern Venture, which includes "Enigmata Saxonica Nuper Inventa Duo" by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.

content.title: August
content.content: 9 - John Stephenson, who would voice Dori, the Great Goblin and Bard the Bowman in the animated version of The Hobbit, is born.

content.title: September
content.content:
21 - Roland Adlerberth is born.
30 - Musician Donald Swann is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives an increase in salary from £600 p.a. to £700 p.a.
23 - Bulletin of the Modern Humanities Research Association, number 20, containing an obituary written by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.

content.title: December
content.content: 24 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

(Spring) - The Microcosm, Vol.8 No.1, including the poem "The City of the Gods" by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
(Autumn) - Tolkien publishes the poem The Cat and the Fiddle.
Years
1920 1921 1922 1923 1924 1925 1926
